content: The $13.1 million decrease in non-interest income in the first quarter of 2022 as compared to the fourth quarter of 2021, was primarily due to a $4.4 million decrease in single-family gain on loan origination and sales activities due to a decrease in rate locked volumes and margins as a result of the effects of increasing interest rates. A $7.4 million decrease in CRE, gain on loan origination sale activities due to no sales of multi-family portfolio loans in the first quarter of 2022 as compared to $244 million of sales of multifamily portfolio loans in the fourth quarter of 2021.
